docs.abstract: He has organized “Blue Black” at the Pulitzer Arts Foundation in St. Louis, hoping to spark discussion about power, spirituality and the blues.
docs.snippet: He has organized “Blue Black” at the Pulitzer Arts Foundation in St. Louis, hoping to spark discussion about power, spirituality and the blues.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the beginning was the word: Fragments of prose by James Baldwin, jokes by Richard Pryor and, later, the testimony of a youth wrongly accused of a crime. All have served as the basis for Glenn Ligon’s series of text paintings and neons exploring race, identity, language and abstraction. Now an Ellsworth Kelly painting, “Blue Black” (2000), has become the departure point for Mr. Ligon’s latest project.

headline.main: How Glenn Ligon Is Using Black and Blue to Begin a Dialogue

docs.abstract: People like Jeremy Corbyn and Bernie Sanders have carried the leftist torch in a long-distance relay. Now they’re handing it to the millennials.
docs.snippet: People like Jeremy Corbyn and Bernie Sanders have carried the leftist torch in a long-distance relay. Now they’re handing it to the millennials.
docs.lead_paragraph: At 68, Jeremy Corbyn has been on the Labour Party’s left flank longer than many of his most enthusiastic supporters — the ones who nearly propelled him to an upset victory in this month’s British general election — have been alive. Bernie Sanders, who won more votes from young people in the 2016 primaries than Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton combined, is 75, and has a demeanor that, honestly, reminds me of my Jewish grandfather. Jean-Luc Mélenchon, the Communist-backed candidate who, thanks to support from young people, surged in the polls ahead of the first round of France’s presidential election, is a sprightly 65.

headline.main: Why Are So Many Young Voters Falling for Old Socialists?
headline.print_headline: Why Young Voters Love Old Socialists

docs.abstract: With skepticism from Hollywood and no support from the rapper’s estate, the makers of “All Eyez on Me” are under pressure to produce a hit.
docs.snippet: With skepticism from Hollywood and no support from the rapper’s estate, the makers of “All Eyez on Me” are under pressure to produce a hit.
docs.lead_paragraph: Though he had been releasing music for only five years when he was killed in 1996 at age 25, Tupac Amaru Shakur’s surplus star power has fueled dozens of posthumous albums, books, documentaries, online conspiracy theories and even a short-lived Broadway musical. In recent years, he has popped up as a hologram in concert and as a guiding spirit on Kendrick Lamar’s “To Pimp a Butterfly”; in April, Shakur became the sixth rap act to be inducted into the Rock and Rock Hall of Fame. His relevance has rarely waned.

headline.main: The Tupac Biopic: What Took So Long?

docs.abstract: We invited readers to share their stories of raising boys to believe in the full equality of men and women. Here is a selection, with responses from experts in the field.

docs.lead_paragraph: We invited readers to share their stories of raising boys to believe in the full equality of men and women. Here is a selection, with responses from experts in the field.

headline.main: 'Men Need to Step Up': Readers and Experts Reflect on Raising Feminist Boys
